replies.body:
I will paste a comment I made on another topic like this...

You guys need to stay calm.

IMO, dual wielding will be fun and it will allow for more options in PVP. 
Imagine, if you have a sword and you need to switch to make some extra damage to a hard opponent.

Just dual wield a bow as well and go ham.
Hell, even dual wield two bows and walk out like a champion gunslinger and light up your foes. 
You guys focus too much on the negatives. This will not ruin PVP, in fact it will add more depth to it.

And what's wrong with learning the ropes again? Only close-minded people and ones who cannot adapt will complain about this. 

You learned it once, you can learn it again.

And in what way does this makeMinecraft like COD? In Halo 3 you can dual wield, in Star Wars you can dual wield light sabers, in COD you only dual wield certain pistols and SMGs. 

Please, stop this.

replies.body:
Ok to start with, they haven't fixed the mechanics they ruined in 1.8 which makes it even more worse. Mixing something that's broken with something disgusting isn't ok right? KB is just trash right now and you can clearly see it in CTH for example where you can just hit someone twice and he would literally fly 8 blocks away or, sometimes if you hit someone over 10 times, he would just move 1 block. I don't really know how could they mess it up so much.
Hit detection is another problem, sometimes you wouldn't reach the hitbox but still hit the other guy which gives some people an insane advantage over the others. If you don't get what I'm trying to say just imagine someone that can't aim at all but giving insane combos without even looking at the other guy (Noobs  being good cause of the broken mechanics again) or imagine the autoclickers as well + the delay here in Avicus is amazing, it doesn't matter if you're lagging or not, your hits still wouldn't register at all sometimes.
Block lag, well, I don't need to explain this right? You can ask some rushers and most of them will tell you they're annoyed with it.
Duel wielding. This is not an FPS game, you got COD, CS:GO and some other games for that. The main purpose of MC is survival and bulding and I find it useless having more weapons just to kill the few type of mobs we have. The sword and bow were just enough + how would block hit work? I don't like the idea of swaping from one weapon to another, it doesn't match with the game's main aim.
Servers and cheaters. Imagine what would happen with the 1v1 servers we have right now. Imagine shields in Kohi or bows with op quivers, it wouldn't fit and I already see people quitting from here. Cheaters would just make more clients and abuse the new weapons and the damage they can do which would break the game even more making it more unfair than it already is.

I can keep going on but I'm too lazy, sorry for the bad grammar, I'm in a hurry.

Ok to start with, they haven't fixed the mechanics they ruined in 1.8 which makes it even more worse. Mixing something that's broken with something disgusting isn't ok right? KB is just trash right now and you can clearly see it in CTH for example where you can just hit someone twice and he would literally fly 8 blocks away or, sometimes if you hit someone over 10 times, he would just move 1 block. I don't really know how could they mess it up so much.
I do not know whether they will fix this or not but I believe it will be fixed. You have to give them a chance. Besides, if it only happens in one gamemode, then how is that 1.8's fault? Nexus used to have the super fast click glitch even in 1.7 only.

Hit detection is another problem, sometimes you wouldn't reach the hitbox but still hit the other guy which gives some people an insane advantage over the others. If you don't get what I'm trying to say just imagine someone that can't aim at all but giving insane combos without even looking at the other guy (Noobs  being good cause of the broken mechanics again) or imagine the autoclickers as well + the delay here in Avicus is amazing, it doesn't matter if you're lagging or not, your hits still wouldn't register at all sometimes.
I believe that it will most likely be fixed in this update. Probably. Take it up with the developers of Minecraft.

Block lag, well, I don't need to explain this right? You can ask some rushers and most of them will tell you they're annoyed with it.
How is this 1.'s fault? You can blame this on NCP...

Duel wielding. This is not an FPS game, you got COD, CS:GO and some other games for that. The main purpose of MC is survival and bulding and I find it useless having more weapons just to kill the few type of mobs we have. The sword and bow were just enough + how would block hit work?
I know another voxel game that uses dual wielding as a main mechanic... Skysaga... stop comparing this to FPS's... "Its not like you're gonna go on a: OMG I GOT A 23 KILL STREAK!!11!!" Stop comparing this to an FPS, you're not dual wielding pistols neither SMGs..

I don't like the idea of swaping from one weapon to another, it doesn't match with the game's main aim.
Servers and cheaters. Imagine what would happen with the 1v1 servers we have right now. Imagine shields in Kohi or bows with op quivers, it wouldn't fit and I already see people quitting from here. Cheaters would just make more clients and abuse the new weapons and the damage they can do which would break the game even more making it more unfair than it already is.
You swap out weapons on a daily to switch to a tool, surely you can do this as well? Obviously, the same type of quivers will be given to all players so this is a null point. If they quit then that is on them for not accepting change. Don't cheaters already make clients? This is something we will have to cope with all the time.
.

replies.body:
What I've Found While On The Snapshot.
-Blocking is still a thing.
-Block-hitting more closely resembles the 1.7 version as opposed to 1.8
-Cannot use bow in off-hand slot.
-Ender Pearls are smaller and move faster.
-Splash water bottles. They can put out blocks on fire and entities on fire.
-We seem to still have 1.8 style knockback, but I'm not sure about hit-detection because I can't find a pvp server on 1.9.
This is the first snapshot, MANY things will probably change. Certain features are still supposed to be added, while a majority of features now are still not finished. I.E. Dual wielding, dragon respawns, etc.
